Feature: demo_StudioOnPlateau
Scenario: Step1_Login StudioOnPlateau
Given validate initial Login pageAnd write Email "byburakyesiltas+51@gmail.com"
And write Password "Aa123456"
When clicks on Login button

public class Login extends DriverManager {
@Given("validate initial Login page")public void validate_initial_Login_page() {
WebElement loginPage = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//h1[text()='Login']", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Assertion.ElementExist(loginPage);
}
@And("write Email {string}")
public void write_Email(String email) {WebElement emailTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_email", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(emailTbx, email, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@And("write Password {string}")
public void write_Password(String password) {WebElement passwordTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_loginPassword", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(passwordTbx, password, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@When("clicks on Login button")
public void clicks_on_Login_button() {WebElement loginBtn = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_login-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.clickFunction(loginBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@Then("user is navigate to the home page")
public void user_is_navigate_to_the_home_page() {WebElement homePage = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//img[@id='dropdownMenuButton1']", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Assertion.ElementExist(homePage);
}
} Senaryolardan test otomasyonu yazÄ±mÄ± Input
Scenario: Step2_Create OrganizationGiven clicks on Create Organization button
And write Organization Name "TestOtomasyonYZ"
When clicks on Organization Create button
Then verify Organization Name "TestOtomasyonYZ" Senaryolardan test otomasyonu yazÄ±mÄ± Google Outputpublic class CreateOrganization extends DriverManager {  
@Given("clicks on Create Organization button")
public void clicks_on_Create_Organization_button() {WebElement createOrgBtn = Find.Element(Locator.id, "create-organization-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.clickFunction(createOrgBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@And("write Organization Name {string}")public void write_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement orgNameTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "organization-name", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(orgNameTbx, organizationName, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}}  
@When("clicks on Organization Create button")
public void clicks_on_Organization_Create_button() {
WebElement createOrgBtn = Find.Element(Locator.id, "create-organization-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);Util.clickFunction(createOrgBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@Then("verify Organization Name {string}")
public void verify_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement orgName = Find.Element(Locator.id, "organization-name", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);Assertion.TextExactMatch(orgName, organizationName);
}  
} Senaryolardan test otomasyonu yazÄ±mÄ± Our Code
public class CreateOrganization extends DriverManager {  
@Given("clicks on Create Organization button")public void clicks_on_Create_Organization_button() {
WebElement createOrganizationBtn = Find.Element(Locator.className, "create-organization-button", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Util.clickFunction(createOrganizationBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}}  
@And("write Organization Name {string}")
public void write_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement organizationNameTbx = Find.Element(Locator.className, "inputClass", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);Util.sendKeysFunction(organizationNameTbx, organizationName, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@When("clicks on Organization Create button")
public void clicks_on_Organization_Create_button() {WebElement organizationCreateBtn = Find.Element(Locator.className, "create-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.clickFunction(organizationCreateBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@Then("verify Organization Name {string}")public void verify_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement organizationNameTxt = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//div[@class='selected selected-org']//div[text()='" + organizationName + " ']", FTimeOut.HIGH);Assertion.ElementExist(organizationNameTxt);
}

Ä°stemlerin temel parÃ§alarÄ± baÄŸlam, talimat ve Ã¶rnektir.BaÄŸlam: BaÄŸlam, takip eden bilgilerin aÅŸamasÄ±nÄ± belirler. Bu, anahtar terimlerin ve ilgili durumlarÄ±n tanÄ±mlanmasÄ±nÄ± veya sadece arka plan bilgilerinin saÄŸlanmasÄ±nÄ± iÃ§erebilir. BaÄŸlam, yapay zekanÄ±n bilgi isteminde ele alÄ±nan genel temayÄ± veyaele alÄ±nan genel temayÄ± veya konuyu anlamasÄ±na yardÄ±mcÄ± olur.Talimat: Talimat, istemin temel bileÅŸenidir. Yapay zekanÄ±n gerÃ§ekleÅŸtirmesi veya yanÄ±tlamasÄ± beklenen gÃ¶revi veya soruyu aÃ§Ä±kÃ§a belirttiÄŸiniz yer burasÄ±dÄ±r. YanÄ±t iÃ§in tÃ¼m yÃ¶nergeleri veya kriterleri belirterek talimatlarÄ±nÄ±zÄ±n aÃ§Ä±k ve doÄŸrudanaÃ§Ä±k ve doÄŸrudan olmasÄ± Ã¶nemlidir.Ã–rnek: BazÄ± durumlarda istenen Ã§Ä±ktÄ±yÄ± yÃ¶nlendirmek veya aÃ§Ä±klÄ±ÄŸa kavuÅŸturmak iÃ§in bir veya daha fazla Ã¶rnek vermek faydalÄ± olabilir. Ã–rnekler yapay zeka iÃ§in bir model gÃ¶revi gÃ¶rebilir ve baÅŸarÄ±lÄ± bir yanÄ±tÄ±n nasÄ±l olmasÄ± gerektiÄŸine dair bir fikirgerektiÄŸine dair bir fikir verebilir. Bu, Ã¶zellikle gÃ¶rev karmaÅŸÄ±k olduÄŸunda veya belirli biÃ§imlendirme gereksinimlerine sahip olduÄŸunda kullanÄ±ÅŸlÄ±dÄ±r.Ä°yi Ä°stemler YazmanÄ±n PÃ¼f NoktalarÄ± Sistem mesajlarÄ± yapay zekanÄ±n davranÄ±ÅŸÄ±nÄ± ayarlamak iÃ§in ilk talimatlarÄ± saÄŸlarlar. Etkili bir ÅŸekilde kullanÄ±ldÄ±ÄŸÄ±nda, modelin yanÄ±tlarÄ±nÄ±n baÄŸlamÄ±nÄ± ve tonunu bÃ¼yÃ¼k Ã¶lÃ§Ã¼de etkileyerek daha iyi sonuÃ§laretkileyerek daha iyi sonuÃ§lar verebilirler. Sistem mesajlarÄ± olabildiÄŸince kÄ±sa tutulmalÄ±dÄ±r (125 karakter ideal).Ã–rnek bir sistem mesajÄ±:Sen yalnÄ±zca taÅŸ kaÄŸÄ±t makas oynayabilen bir {ai_style} asistanÄ±sÄ±n. TaÅŸ kaÄŸÄ±t makas oynamakla ilgili olmayan sorularÄ± yanÄ±tlamayacaksÄ±n. Siz ve kullanÄ±cÄ± az Ã¶nce taÅŸ kaÄŸÄ±t ve makas oynadÄ±nÄ±z. Bu maÃ§Ä±n sonucu: {match_result}. MaÃ§la ilgili ÅŸaka yap.MaÃ§la ilgili ÅŸaka yap. KullanÄ±cÄ± aynÄ± hamleyi oynamaya devam ederse bununla ilgili ÅŸaka yap. Ä°yi Ä°stemler YazmanÄ±n PÃ¼f NoktalarÄ± Verileri istemden ayÄ±rmak iÃ§in sÄ±nÄ±rlayÄ±cÄ±larÄ± (delimeters) kullanmakSÄ±nÄ±rlayÄ±cÄ±larÄ± uygun seÃ§meli (metinin kendisinde bulunmayacak nadir semboller seÃ§mek), doÄŸru konumlandÄ±rmalÄ± (verinin baÅŸÄ±na ve sonuna), tutarlÄ± olmalÄ±sÄ±nÄ±z(hep aynÄ± gÃ¶rev iÃ§in aynÄ± sÄ±nÄ±rlayÄ±cÄ± kullanmak).ÃœÃ§lÃ¼ sÃ¼slÃ¼ parantezlerle ayrÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ metni tek bir cÃ¼mle halinde Ã¶zetleyin.
{{{metninizi_buraya_ekleyin}}}
ÃœÃ§lÃ¼ tÄ±rnak iÅŸaretiyle ayrÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ metni ArapÃ§aya Ã§evir
"""NasÄ±lsÄ±n?"""  
Ä°yi Ä°stemler YazmanÄ±n PÃ¼f NoktalarÄ± YapÄ±landÄ±rÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ Bir Ã‡Ä±ktÄ± Ä°stemek"<inceleme>" etiketinin iÃ§ine alÄ±nmÄ±ÅŸ metinden `product` (Ã¼rÃ¼nÃ¼n adÄ±), `isPositive` (boolean), `summary` anahtarlarÄ±nÄ± iÃ§eren bir JSON nesnesi oluÅŸturmama yardÄ±mcÄ± ol.
<inceleme>Ne yazÄ±k ki "XYZ ProTech 2000" Ã¼rÃ¼nÃ¼ en temel beklentileri bile karÅŸÄ±layamadÄ±. Kafa karÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±cÄ± kullanÄ±cÄ± arayÃ¼zÃ¼nden, berbat performansÄ±na kadar bu Ã¼rÃ¼n beni derinden tatminsiz bÄ±raktÄ±. "XYZ ProTech 2000" satÄ±n almayÄ± dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼yorsanÄ±z Ã¼stÃ¼n kalite veÃ¼stÃ¼n kalite ve gÃ¼venilirlik sunan alternatif seÃ§enekleri keÅŸfetmenizi ÅŸiddetle tavsiye ederim.</inceleme>
Cevap:
{
"product": "XYZ ProTech 2000",
"isPositive": false,
"summary": "Failed to meet expectations due to lackluster build quality, confusing user interface, abysmal performance, and disappointing customer support."
}}

### Transformers  
* Encoder Only Models :  
also work as sequence-to-sequence models, but without further modification,the input sequence and the output sequence or the same length. Their use is
less common these days, but by adding additional layers to the architecture,
you can train encoder-only models to perform classification tasks such assentiment analysis, BERT is an example of an encoder-only model.  
aynÄ± zamanda diziden diziye modeller olarak da Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r, ancak daha fazla
deÄŸiÅŸiklik yapÄ±lmadan giriÅŸ dizisi ve Ã§Ä±kÄ±ÅŸ dizisi veya aynÄ± uzunlukta olur.GÃ¼nÃ¼mÃ¼zde bunlarÄ±n kullanÄ±mÄ± daha az yaygÄ±ndÄ±r, ancak mimariye ek katmanlar
ekleyerek duyarlÄ±lÄ±k analizi gibi sÄ±nÄ±flandÄ±rma gÃ¶revlerini gerÃ§ekleÅŸtirmek
iÃ§in yalnÄ±zca kodlayÄ±cÄ± modellerini eÄŸitebilirsiniz; BERT yalnÄ±zca kodlayÄ±cÄ±modeline bir Ã¶rnektir.  
* Encoder-Decoder Models :  
as you've seen, perform well on sequence-to-sequence tasks such as
translation, where the input sequence and the output sequence can be differentlengths. You can also scale and train this type of model to perform general
text generation tasks. Examples of encoder-decoder models include BART as
opposed to BERT and T5, the model that you'll use in the labs in this course.gÃ¶rdÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼nÃ¼z gibi, giriÅŸ sÄ±rasÄ± ve Ã§Ä±kÄ±ÅŸ sÄ±rasÄ±nÄ±n farklÄ± uzunluklarda
olabildiÄŸi Ã§eviri gibi sÄ±ralÄ± sÄ±ralÄ± gÃ¶revlerde iyi performans gÃ¶sterin.
AyrÄ±ca genel metin oluÅŸturma gÃ¶revlerini gerÃ§ekleÅŸtirmek iÃ§in bu model tÃ¼rÃ¼nÃ¼Ã¶lÃ§eklendirebilir ve eÄŸitebilirsiniz. KodlayÄ±cÄ±-kod Ã§Ã¶zÃ¼cÃ¼ modellerine Ã¶rnek
olarak, bu kursta laboratuvarlarda kullanacaÄŸÄ±nÄ±z model olan BERT ve T5'in
aksine BART gÃ¶sterilebilir.  
* Decoder Only Models :* Decoder Only Models :  
are some of the most commonly used today. Again, as they have scaled, their
capabilities have grown. These models can now generalize to most tasks.Popular encoder-only models include the GPT family of models, BLOOM, Jurassic,
LLaMA, and many more.

Quick Answer_ How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss.pdfPage 1:9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss

This research note is restricted to the personal use of Lutfi Ulusoy
(lutfu.ulusoy@softtech.com.tr).Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative Al
Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Published 11 July 2023 - ID G00793773 - 10 min read  
By Dennis Xu, Avivah Litan  
Initiatives: Security Technology and Infrastructure for Technical ProfessionalsChatGPT and generative Al-based products, such as Microsoft 365 Copilot, have seen huge
interest in adoption. Security and risk management technical professionals should adoptthe recommendations in this research to minimize sensitive data loss while continuing to
explore generative Al.  
More on This Topic
This is part of an in-depth collection of research. See the collection:e Security Leaderâ€™s Guide to Data Security  
Quick Answer
How can | use ChatGPT and generative Al (GenAl) securely with minimal sensitive data  
loss?  
e Use security service edge (SSE) to block sensitive information from being entered intoboth the ChatGPT prompt interface and API interface.  
e Carefully examine data security measures from commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) GenAl
products â€” such as Microsoft 365 Copilot â€” to ensure it satisfies your sensitive dataprotection requirements.  
e Build your own GenAl-based application using hosted foundational models to protect
sensitive information with Azure OpenAl Service built-in security measures.e Train your own domain-specific large language model (LLM) with proprietary data to have
the most control over sensitive data protection. This represents an alternative to using  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 1/9Page 2:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss
i pretrained models directly.
More Detail  
ChatGPT and generative Al (GenAl) attract massive interest from multiple industry verticals withthe potential to disrupt many disciplines. While technology and other practitioners from different
sectors continue to explore what ChatGPT can do, security incidents of sensitive data leakagehave started to surface. For example, Samsung has banned the use of ChatGPT on company-
owned devices and internal networks after employees uploaded source code into ChatGPT tocheck for errors. Also, Apple and some large U.S. banks have used similar measures to restrict
the internal use of ChatGPT and other GenAl tools.  
For ChatGPT or GenAl to provide insights that satisfy unique business needs, these tools oftenneed access to organizational proprietary and sensitive datasets. Accordingly, organizational
data could be fed into ChatGPT and GenAl as:  
e System prompts to generate responses from the LLM that combine organizational data.e Training dataset to fine-tune a hosted foundational model, such as GPT-3 in Azure OpenAl.  
e Training dataset to train the domain-specific LLM model from scratch, such as
BloombergGPT.BloombergGPT.  
e Data fed into ChatGPT or other LLM-powered search engines as they crawl through
documents.  
This research discusses critical data security considerations in four ChatGPT and GenAladoption patterns to minimize sensitive data leakage risk. Privacy, regulatory compliance, Al
safety and output guardrails â€” that is, hallucination reduction â€” are out of the scope of thisresearch. Figure 1 illustrates how much control customers have over data security measures
across four adoption patterns.  
Figure 1: Generative Al Shared Responsibility Model Â¥  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 2/9Page 3:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Generative Al Shared Responsibility Model (Data Security)  
i Customer Responsibility | Provider Responsibility  
Build Your Own App onBuild Your Own App on
a Foundational Model  
ChatGPT COTS GenAl Train Your Own LLM

COTS = commercial off-the-shelf; GenAl = generative Al; LLM = large language model
793773_C  
Gartner.793773_C  
Gartner.  
Use Security Service Edge to Block Sensitive Information From Entering Into ChatGPT  
While OpenAl disclosed a number of data controls available in ChatGPT service, manyorganizations are not comfortable with their employees sending sensitive data to ChatGPT. The
SSE forward proxy module can mask, redact or block sensitive data in-line as itâ€™s being enteredinto ChatGPT as a prompt. Security and risk management technical professionals should use
the block option to prevent sensitive data from entering ChatGPT from web or API interfaces.Some SSE vendors are creating a new web category called â€œgenerative Al,â€ and it is
recommended to block sensitive data upload into the â€œgenerative Alâ€ category.The new Bing search chat function is built on top of GPT-4 and has an HTTP client built-in,
allowing users prompting Bing to crawl through external websites and generate insights. Ensureorganizational data loss prevention (DLP) policy is in place. Doing so helps that sensitive
content is not externally shared and accessible from corporate-managed IT resources for thenew Bing search function to crawl through. Organizations should also use SSE or cloud security
posture management (CSPM) to ensure employees do not share sensitive content externallyusing cloud content-sharing solutions, such as OneDrive, Box or Amazon S3. Ultimately, instruct
the new Bing search function to crawl through sensitive content.  
With the release of ChatGPT app for iOS, organizations should use enterprise mobilitymanagement (EMM) to limit employeesâ€™ ability to copy sensitive data from corporate-managed
apps into ChatGPT app.  
Carefully Examine Data Security Measures From COTS Gen-Al ServiceMicrosoft 365 Copilot was announced in March 2023. 1 It is the first prominent COTS GenAl
service â€” also referred to as generative micro apps â€” and has shown huge potential infundamentally changing how business content is created. Although promising, security and risk  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 3/9  
Page 4:Page 4:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss
management technical professionals must examine data security measures and understand the
security implications of Microsoft 365 Copilot.When Microsoft 365 Copilot becomes generally available, organizations should plan their
adoption strategy depending on the data type they are working with. There are three possible
scenarios.  
Scenario 1scenarios.  
Scenario 1  
Organizations dealing with public data without internal or external requirements to protect the
confidentiality of such datasets. These organizations should embrace Microsoft 365 Copilot tounleash creativity, unlock productivity and uplevel skills.  
Scenario 2  
Organizations dealing with proprietary or customer data with internal policy or external regulatory
compliance requirements to protect the confidentiality of such datasets.Microsoft provided high-level insights on the security, compliance and privacy measures used in
Microsoft 365 Copilot in the product announcement. ' It is reasonable to expect more detailedinformation about Microsoft 365 Copilotâ€™s data security measures will be made available by
Microsoft as we get closer to the general availability (GA) release.In the interim, Microsoft provided Gartner with additional details regarding Microsoft 365
Copilot data security measures that are not yet available through Microsoft documentation.Organizations that need to protect proprietary or customer-sensitive data should examine the
questions and Microsoft's responses included in Table 1.  
Table 1: Gartner Questions and Microsoft Responses About Proprietary and CustomerSensitive Data  
Gartner Questions Microsoft Responses  
Microsoft does not use user-generated Microsoft does not use UGC to train any
content (UGC) to train the foundational models used in Microsoft 365 Copilot. 7model (GPT-4) that underpins Microsoft 365

document from which the user requested the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service?The foundational LLM (GPT-4) does not store
or track refined prompts. Itâ€™s up to the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service built on top of
the LLM to store the prompts after the
current session terminates. How does the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service protectprompts if it is stored?  
Once grounded with UGC, the refined prompt
will most likely contain customer-sensitive
data that is sent to the LLM to generate a
response. Is the refined prompt only
transient in memory, or is it persisted in thestorage layer?

prompt, refined prompt and response data
for human review and debugging purposes
within the boundary of Microsoft 365 Copilot

Source: Gartner (July 2023)  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfileQuick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
The Microsoft 365 Copilot uses current usersâ€™
credentials to access data. Therefore, it
cannot access anything the user does not
have access to.have access to.  
There is no label inheritance in place. The
Microsoft 365 Copilot-generated content will
cite the original source UGC, which will retain
the label.  
Usersâ€™ prompts to Microsoft 365 Copilot arestored in the Intelligent Conversation and
Communication Cloud (IC3), the back-end
services used by Microsoft Teams. Microsoft
plans to use this same back end for the
Microsoft 365 Copilot. IC3 supports
compliance features such as e-discovery.The refined prompt is transient in memory in
the Microsoft-hosted LLM runtime. This is a
different feature from OpenAl-hosted GPT
services.  
No. Unless a customer's tenant administrator
approves the user, including such data whenthey provide feedback to improve the service.  
Privacy-preserving ML does not apply to
Microsoft 365 Copilot.  
5/9  
Page 6:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data LossBecause MPIP label inheritance is not currently supported, Gartner recommends organizations
that have already rolled out MPIP to develop a strategy to ensure that Microsoft 365 Copilot-generated documents are protected with proper labels with either manual labels (E3 customers)
or autolabels (E5 customers).  
Gartner anticipates Microsoft to provide more details to the following questions as we getcloser to the GA release of Microsoft 365 Copilot:  
e Does the grounding process have read access into MPIP-protected UGC â€” with Microsoft-
managed keys or bring your own key (BYOK) â€” that the current user is entitled to access?e Can any other back-end service different than LLM runtime access and read refined prompts
and response data?  
e Microsoft 365 Copilot stores refined prompts in IC3. Is IC3 isolated within a client's tenantboundary? Who can access refined prompts in IC3? Can a client opt to delete refined
prompts? Does it generate an access log if refined prompts are accessed or deleted? Cana
client opt to encrypt refined prompts?  
Scenario 3Scenario 3  
Organizations dealing with highly sensitive data that already use MPIP with DKE option or third-
party encryption gateway to prevent Microsoft indexing or e-discovery service from accessingtheir data while stored in Microsoft 365 cloud.  
Continue to use MPIP with DKE or third-party encryption gateway to encrypt most sensitive
content while stored in Microsoft 365 cloud. During the grounding processing, Microsoft 365Copilot has access to encrypted content through Microsoft Graph API. However, it cannot
decrypt â€” as long as you do not grant Microsoft 365 Copilot access to the self-hosted DKE
service or the encryption gatewayâ€™s decryption service.If Microsoft 365 Copilot could be accessed from desktop apps through an additional plug-in
installation, do not install the plug-in into Office desktop apps. Microsoft 365 Copilot plug-in canhave potential access to UGC from within the Microsoft Office apps regardless of whether MPIP
protects the file with DKE or any third-party encryption gateways. As more details aboutMicrosoft 365 Copilot become available, evaluate whether the Microsoft 365 Copilot plug-in can
differentiate and respect the confidentiality protection provided by the MPIP with DKE.Build Your GenAl-Based Application Using Hosted Foundational Models  
Microsoft Azure OpenAl Service is a great option for organizations interested in building GPT-based applications â€” together with other foundational models â€” using proprietary, confidential
data. This approach provides organizations with greater flexibility in securing their confidential  
data. Highlights of data security measures include: Â°https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 6/9  
Page 7:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Losse Customer is responsible for the application, including the security aspect, built on top of
Microsoft Azure OpenAl Service.  
e Confidential data could be fed into Microsoft Azure OpenAl Service as prompt or training
data.data.  
e Prompts and completion are not stored in the deployed model runtime â€” whether custom
fine-tuned model or base models â€” except for a separate copy of prompts and completionsstored for Microsoft human review or debugging purposes that could be turned off with client
request and Microsoft approval.  
e Customer-uploaded training data and fine-tuned models are stored in Azure Storage andencrypted at rest by Microsoft-managed keys, with the option to use customer-managed keys
(CMkKs). The training data and fine-tuned models are logically isolated with Azure
subscription and API credentials.Train Your Own Domain-Specific LLM Using Proprietary Data  
Organizations training domain-specific LLM using proprietary data will have the most control
over sensitive data protection â€” examples include BloombergGPT. This is the best option froma data security perspective. This approach is only viable for organizations with the right ML and
deep learning skills, compute resources and budget.

Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±rmak Ä°stemlerin Ã–nyargÄ±sÄ±nÄ± AzaltmaÄ°stemler oluÅŸtururken Ã§Ä±ktÄ±daki Ã¶nyargÄ±larÄ± ortadan kaldÄ±rmayÄ± gÃ¶z Ã¶nÃ¼nde bulundurarak, yapay zeka tarafÄ±ndan oluÅŸturulan yanÄ±tlarda adaleti, tarafsÄ±zlÄ±ÄŸÄ± ve kapsayÄ±cÄ±lÄ±ÄŸÄ± teÅŸvik etmeyi amaÃ§larÄ±z.

Ä°stemlerinizdeki Ã¶nyargÄ±larÄ± gidermek iÃ§in:
Objektif Ä°fade: Objektif bir dil kullanÄ±n ve etnik, cinsiyet,milliyet veya diÄŸer olasÄ± Ã¶nyargÄ±lÄ± Ã¶zellikler hakkÄ±nda varsayÄ±mlarda bulunmaktan kaÃ§Ä±nÄ±n.Adil Temsil: Modelin adil ve tarafsÄ±z yanÄ±tlar Ã¼retmeyi Ã¶ÄŸrenmesi iÃ§in istemlerin farklÄ± bakÄ±ÅŸ aÃ§Ä±larÄ±nÄ± ve deneyimleri temsil ettiÄŸinden emin olun.KarÅŸÄ± dengeleme: Ä°steminin baÄŸlamÄ± veya doÄŸasÄ± nedeniyle bir Ã¶nyargÄ± kaÃ§Ä±nÄ±lmazsa, argÃ¼mana alternatif bir bakÄ±ÅŸ aÃ§Ä±sÄ± veya taraf sunarak bunu dengelemeyi dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼n.Test Etme ve Yineleme: Potansiyel Ã¶nyargÄ±larÄ± belirlemek ve dÃ¼zeltmek iÃ§in Ã§eÅŸitli incelemecilerden oluÅŸan bir gruptan geri bildirim alarak istemlerinizi sÃ¼rekli olarak test edin ve yineleyin.  
Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±rmak Ä°stemleri BirleÅŸtirmekBirleÅŸtirme, birden fazla farklÄ± modeli birleÅŸtirerek, tahminlerin gÃ¼venilirliÄŸini ve doÄŸruluÄŸunu artÄ±rmak iÃ§in kullanÄ±lan bir tekniktir.  
BirleÅŸtirme teknikleri:BirleÅŸtirme teknikleri:
Ã‡oÄŸunluÄŸun oyu: Her model belirli bir Ã§Ä±ktÄ±ya oy verir ve en Ã§ok oyu alan nihai tahmin olarak seÃ§ilir.AÄŸÄ±rlÄ±klÄ± oylama: Ã‡oÄŸunluk oylamasÄ±na benzer ancak her modelin performansÄ±na, doÄŸruluÄŸuna veya diÄŸer kriterlerine dayalÄ± olarak Ã¶nceden tanÄ±mlanmÄ±ÅŸ bir aÄŸÄ±rlÄ±ÄŸÄ± vardÄ±r. Nihai tahmin, tÃ¼m model tahminlerinin aÄŸÄ±rlÄ±klÄ± toplamÄ±na dayanmaktadÄ±r.Ã–ntoplama (Bagging-Bootstrap Aggregation): Her model, genellikle orijinal veri kÃ¼mesinden deÄŸiÅŸtirilerek (Ã¶nyÃ¼kleme) Ã¶rnekleme yoluyla oluÅŸturulan biraz farklÄ± bir veri kÃ¼mesi Ã¼zerinde eÄŸitilir. Tahminler daha sonra genellikle Ã§oÄŸunluk oyu veyagenellikle Ã§oÄŸunluk oyu veya ortalama alma yoluyla birleÅŸtirilir.Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±rmak Ä°stemleri BirleÅŸtirmek (Devam)

Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±rmak LLM Ã–zdeÄŸerlendirmesiBir yapay zeka modelinin kendi performansÄ±nÄ± deÄŸerlendirme yÃ¶ntemidir.Objektif Ã¶lÃ§Ã¼mler: Bir yanÄ±tÄ±n kalitesini belirleyen niceliksel Ã¶lÃ§Ã¼mler geliÅŸtirebilirsiniz. Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±rmak DiÄŸer Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±ran YÃ¶ntemlerBiÃ§imlendirme ipuÃ§larÄ±: Matematiksel semboller, denklemler veya deÄŸiÅŸkenler iÃ§in LaTeX formatÄ±nÄ± veya aÃ§Ä±k gÃ¶sterimleri kullanÄ±n.Hata yÃ¶netimi: LLMâ€™in yapabileceÄŸi olasÄ± hatalarÄ± veya yanlÄ±ÅŸ anlamalarÄ± tahmin edip ve bu durumlarÄ±n nasÄ±l ele alÄ±nacaÄŸÄ± konusunda ona aÃ§Ä±kÃ§a talimat verebilrsiniz. SÄ±caklÄ±k (temperature) DeÄŸiÅŸkeniSÄ±caklÄ±k, dil modeli tarafÄ±ndan oluÅŸturulan Ã§Ä±ktÄ±nÄ±n rastgeleliÄŸini kontrol eden bir hiperparametredir. Maksimum token, model tarafÄ±ndan oluÅŸturulan Ã§Ä±ktÄ±nÄ±n uzunluÄŸunu belirler. LLM AyarlarÄ± En iyi P (top_p) DeÄŸiÅŸkeniÃ‡ekirdek Ã¶rneklemesi (nucleus sampling) olarak da bilinen Top P, bir modelin oluÅŸturulan Ã§Ä±ktÄ±sÄ±nÄ±n rastgeleliÄŸini kontrol etmek iÃ§in daha dinamik bir yol saÄŸlayan bir yÃ¶ntemdir.Top P Ã¶rneklemesi, Top K Ã¶rneklemesinde olduÄŸu gibi en yÃ¼ksek olasÄ±lÄ±ÄŸa sahip en olasÄ± K tokeni seÃ§mek yerine, kÃ¼mÃ¼latif olasÄ±lÄ±klarÄ± verilen P deÄŸerine eÅŸit olan bir dizi tokeni seÃ§er.P, 0 ile 1 arasÄ±nda bir aralÄ±kta olan bir olasÄ±lÄ±k kÃ¼tlesidir. SÄ±caklÄ±k (temperature) DeÄŸiÅŸkeniSÄ±caklÄ±k, dil modeli tarafÄ±ndan oluÅŸturulan Ã§Ä±ktÄ±nÄ±n rastgeleliÄŸini kontrol eden bir hiperparametredir. LLM AyarlarÄ± En iyi K (top_k) DeÄŸiÅŸkeniEn iyi K Ã¶rneklemesi, dil modelinin dikkate alabileceÄŸi tahmin edilen sÃ¶zcÃ¼k sayÄ±sÄ±nÄ± sÄ±nÄ±rlamaya yÃ¶nelik bir yaklaÅŸÄ±mdÄ±r. Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Test EdiciÄ°stem Ã–rnekleri Test Edici

Inference : the act of generating text  
neural network :

Prompt : The text that you feed into the model

Output text : completion  
Context window : The full amount of text or the memory that is available to
use for the promptuse for the prompt  
Prompt engineering : you'll frequently encounter situations where the model
doesn't produce the outcome that you want on the first try. You may have torevise the language in your prompt or the way that it's written several times
to get the model to behave in the way that you want. This work to develop and
iprove the prompt is known as prompt engineering.In-context learning : Providing examples inside the context window is called
in-context learning.  
zero-shot inference : Prompt as an instruction to produce the completionone-shot inference : Prompt as an instruction to produce the completion and
also has an example how to do it.  
few-shot inference : Sometimes a single example won't be enough for the modelto learn what you want it to do. So you can extend the idea of giving a single
example to include multiple examples. This is known as few-shot inferenceZure Ã¼zerinden OpenAI kullanÄ±mÄ± saÄŸlanmaktadÄ±r. AyrÄ±ca Google modellerine
eriÅŸim de softtech adreslerinize yetkilendirilmektedir.

image-2023-11-3_8-55-29.png\v_ How does this course differ from Al for Everyone?  
The world of Al has changed rapidly in the past 18 months. Large language models (LLMs) and other generative Alapplications have taken the world by storm, and continue to evolve. Our new course teaches the most up-to-date
information regarding these revolutionary tools and technologies.  
\Y_ Who is this course for?\Y_ Who is this course for?  
This course is designed to provide value to anyone interested in learning about generative Al, its impacts, and how to.use it. Business leaders will learn how generative Al can impact business, and how to develop a generative Al strategy
to increase productivity, professionals will gain practical experience using Al in the workplace, and Al tools andtechniques to apply at work. Developers working outside the world of Al will get a foundational knowledge of the
current state of Al that will help in upskilling or reskilling in the realm of Al.Alis a transformative technology that will impact everyone. Understanding how it works and how to use it puts you in
the driverâ€™s seat.  
\v_ Do! need prior experience?  
No, this course doesnâ€™t require any prior knowledge of Al or coding skills.Konu : Prompt Engineering - GÃ¼venlik

**Ã–zet**  
Uygulama, .pdf, .docx, .md, .txt uzantÄ±lÄ± dosyalar Ã¼zerinden soru cevapyapmayÄ± destekler. Ã–ncelikle, create-env-file endpointi ile kullanÄ±cÄ±nÄ±n
env.json dosyasÄ± oluÅŸturulur. Bu dosyada openai api key gibi bilgiler yer
alÄ±r. Daha sonrasÄ±nda upload-file endpointi ile dosya seÃ§ilir ve yÃ¼klenir.SeÃ§ilen dosyanÄ±n iÃ§erisindeki textler alÄ±nÄ±r ve chunklara ayrÄ±lÄ±r. Daha sonra
dÃ¶kÃ¼manÄ±n TÃ¼rkÃ§e olup olmadÄ±ÄŸÄ± tespit edilir ve ilgili embeddinge yollanÄ±r.
Embeddingin oluÅŸturduÄŸu vektÃ¶rler, FAISS vector store'da tutulur ve bu vectorstore .pkl dosyasÄ±nda tutulur. Soru sorma iÅŸlemi, oluÅŸturulan vector store
Ã¼zerinden gerÃ§ekleÅŸir. Langchain kullanÄ±lmak istenirse,
ConversationalRetrievalChain veya RetrievalQA zincirleri seÃ§enek olarakmevcuttur. Memory olarak ise ConversationalBufferMemory kullanÄ±lÄ±r. Daha
sonrasÄ±nda ise Azure OpenAI'a kullanÄ±cÄ±nÄ±n girdiÄŸi soru yollanÄ±r ve cevabÄ±
getirilir. EÄŸer kullanÄ±cÄ±, langchain yerine kendi istemiyle soru-cevap yapmakisterse, istemini oluÅŸturur ve openai isteÄŸi oluÅŸturulur.  
KÄ±saca, kullanÄ±cÄ± isterse langchaini base yapÄ± olarak kullanabilir. EÄŸer
langchain kullanÄ±cÄ±nÄ±n problemine uygun deÄŸilse ve kendi istemleriylegeliÅŸtirme yapmak isterse, send-prompt endpointi Ã¼stÃ¼nden kendi istemini
yazarak uygulamayÄ± kendi problemine uygun olarak dÃ¼zenleyebilir.  
AyrÄ±ca, lokum versiyonu iÃ§in geliÅŸtirilmiÅŸ olan tek bir .pkl Ã¼zerindenyÃ¼klenen bÃ¼tÃ¼n dÃ¶kÃ¼manlar iÃ§in soru-cevap yapma Ã¶zelliÄŸini kullanmak iÃ§in;
upload-file-lokum, ask-question-lokum ve delete-file endpointleri
kullanÄ±labilir.

Transcript :  
Ã¶zet:  
The primary concern is the trustworthiness and security of LLMs, especially
when they are deployed in production[1].
The discussed company is focused on securing LLMs by reducing theirvulnerability to attacks, such as the exposure of sensitive training data, and
mitigating risks associated with deployment[2]``[3].
They introduced a set of tools and methods aimed at automatically assessingLLM risks and protecting models during development and deployment. This
involves both red teaming (testing for weaknesses) and blue teaming
(protecting against them) in a continuous improvement cycle[4]``[5].A concept of a trust score was presented, which would provide a radial map of
various dimensions of harm for LLMs. This includes evaluating LLMs based on a
large dataset of prompts that are both innocuous and designed to elicit
harmful outputs[6].harmful outputs[6].
A discussion of expanding the focus from models to agents and multi-agent
systems was mentioned, emphasizing the need to build security into the
platform layer before applications[7].Key considerations for Turkish partners include the localization of the
offering (translating prompts and responses to Turkish), regulations
preventing the use of cloud solutions for personal and banking data in Turkey,and enhancing models to work with Turkish language effectively[8].
The representatives from the developed company show an intent to work closely
with IshBank and SoftTech to tailor the solution to their specific needs andregulations, and they propose starting with a proof of concept (POC) to allow
testing and incremental evaluation of capabilities. Feedback from the
attendees indicates that they see potential in the offering but would like tosee the solutions in action to assess their effectiveness before making
further commitments. The meeting concludes with a sense of agreement on the
validity of the problems being tackled and interest in proceeding with duediligence and evaluation from IshBank's and SoftTech's data science teams.

public class Login extends DriverManager {
@Given("validate initial Login page")public void validate_initial_Login_page() {
WebElement loginPage = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//h1[text()='Login']", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Assertion.ElementExist(loginPage);
}
@And("write Email {string}")
public void write_Email(String email) {WebElement emailTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_email", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(emailTbx, email, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@And("write Password {string}")
public void write_Password(String password) {WebElement passwordTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_loginPassword", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(passwordTbx, password, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@When("clicks on Login button")
public void clicks_on_Login_button() {WebElement loginBtn = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_login-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.clickFunction(loginBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@Then("user is navigate to the home page")
public void user_is_navigate_to_the_home_page() {WebElement homePage = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//img[@id='dropdownMenuButton1']", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Assertion.ElementExist(homePage);
}

public class CreateOrganization extends DriverManager {

Ä°yi Ä°stemler YazmanÄ±n PÃ¼f NoktalarÄ± YapÄ±landÄ±rÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ Bir Ã‡Ä±ktÄ± Ä°stemek"<inceleme>" etiketinin iÃ§ine alÄ±nmÄ±ÅŸ metinden `product` (Ã¼rÃ¼nÃ¼n adÄ±), `isPositive` (boolean), `summary` anahtarlarÄ±nÄ± iÃ§eren bir JSON nesnesi oluÅŸturmama yardÄ±mcÄ± ol.

KitabÄ± elinden bÄ±rakmak zordu. â€” {sentiment_label}Ä°stem Yazma Teknikleri BirkaÃ§ AtÄ±mlÄ± Ä°stem Yazma (Devam)OpenAI modellerinden edindiÄŸim deneyimlere dayanarak prompt uzunluÄŸuyla ilgili farklÄ± modellerin farklÄ± uzunluÄŸu tercih ettiÄŸini sÃ¶yleyebiliriz. Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Test EdiciÄ°stem Ã–rnekleri Test Edici

Hata ayÄ±klama, kod oluÅŸturma, yeniden biÃ§imlendirme, aÃ§Ä±klama ve daha fazlasÄ± iÃ§in LLMâ€™leri kullanabilirsiniz.KÄ±demsiz bir python programcÄ±sÄ±sÄ±n. print(madlib) Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Kodu Yorumlama ve Yeniden BiÃ§imlendirmekLLMâ€™den kodunuzu aÃ§Ä±klamasÄ±nÄ± ve okunabilirliÄŸi arttÄ±rmak iÃ§in yeniden biÃ§imlendirmesini isteyebilirsiniz.
LÃ¼tfen bu Python koduna aÃ§Ä±kla ve okunabilirlik iÃ§in yeniden biÃ§imlendir:

frequency = 2
num_points = 50frequency = 2
num_points = 50
for i in range(num_points):

print(' ' * (amplitude + y) + '*') Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Hata AyÄ±klamakLLMâ€™ler yalnÄ±zca koddaki sÃ¶zdizimi hatalarÄ±nÄ± tespit etmekle kalmaz, aynÄ± zamanda kod yÃ¼rÃ¼tÃ¼ldÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼nde ortaya Ã§Ä±kabilecek mantÄ±ksal hatalarÄ± da bulabilir.
LÃ¼tfen bu Python kodunda hata ayÄ±klayÄ±n:

Daha ayrÄ±ntÄ±lÄ± hatalarÄ±n tespiti iÃ§in daha fazla ayrÄ±ntÄ± eklemeniz gerekebilir: Bu ayrÄ±ntÄ±lar hata mesajÄ±, ortam deÄŸiÅŸkenleri, dahil edilen kitaplÄ±klar veya girdideki deÄŸiÅŸiklikler olabilir. Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Kodu Optimize EtmeKodunuzun yÃ¼rÃ¼tÃ¼lmesi Ã§ok uzun sÃ¼rÃ¼yorsa LLMâ€™ler onu optimize edebilir.

Ä°yi Ä°stemler YazmanÄ±n PÃ¼f NoktalarÄ± YapÄ±landÄ±rÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ Bir Ã‡Ä±ktÄ± Ä°stemek"<inceleme>" etiketinin iÃ§ine alÄ±nmÄ±ÅŸ metinden `product` (Ã¼rÃ¼nÃ¼n adÄ±), `isPositive` (boolean), `summary` anahtarlarÄ±nÄ± iÃ§eren bir JSON nesnesi oluÅŸturmama yardÄ±mcÄ± ol.
<inceleme>Ne yazÄ±k ki "XYZ ProTech 2000" Ã¼rÃ¼nÃ¼ en temel beklentileri bile karÅŸÄ±layamadÄ±. Kafa karÄ±ÅŸtÄ±rÄ±cÄ± kullanÄ±cÄ± arayÃ¼zÃ¼nden, berbat performansÄ±na kadar bu Ã¼rÃ¼n beni derinden tatminsiz bÄ±raktÄ±. Cevap:

Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Test EdiciÄ°stem Ã–rnekleri Test Edici

### Transformers  
* Encoder Only Models :  
also work as sequence-to-sequence models, but without further modification,the input sequence and the output sequence or the same length. Their use is
less common these days, but by adding additional layers to the architecture,
you can train encoder-only models to perform classification tasks such assentiment analysis, BERT is an example of an encoder-only model.  
aynÄ± zamanda diziden diziye modeller olarak da Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r, ancak daha fazla
deÄŸiÅŸiklik yapÄ±lmadan giriÅŸ dizisi ve Ã§Ä±kÄ±ÅŸ dizisi veya aynÄ± uzunlukta olur.GÃ¼nÃ¼mÃ¼zde bunlarÄ±n kullanÄ±mÄ± daha az yaygÄ±ndÄ±r, ancak mimariye ek katmanlar
ekleyerek duyarlÄ±lÄ±k analizi gibi sÄ±nÄ±flandÄ±rma gÃ¶revlerini gerÃ§ekleÅŸtirmek
iÃ§in yalnÄ±zca kodlayÄ±cÄ± modellerini eÄŸitebilirsiniz; BERT yalnÄ±zca kodlayÄ±cÄ±modeline bir Ã¶rnektir.  
* Encoder-Decoder Models :  
as you've seen, perform well on sequence-to-sequence tasks such as
translation, where the input sequence and the output sequence can be differentlengths. You can also scale and train this type of model to perform general
text generation tasks. Examples of encoder-decoder models include BART as
opposed to BERT and T5, the model that you'll use in the labs in this course.gÃ¶rdÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼nÃ¼z gibi, giriÅŸ sÄ±rasÄ± ve Ã§Ä±kÄ±ÅŸ sÄ±rasÄ±nÄ±n farklÄ± uzunluklarda
olabildiÄŸi Ã§eviri gibi sÄ±ralÄ± sÄ±ralÄ± gÃ¶revlerde iyi performans gÃ¶sterin.

Quick Answer_ How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss.pdfPage 1:9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Gartner.  
Licensed for Distribution  
This research note is restricted to the personal use of Lutfi Ulusoy
(lutfu.ulusoy@softtech.com.tr).Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative Al
Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Published 11 July 2023 - ID G00793773 - 10 min read  
By Dennis Xu, Avivah Litan  
Initiatives: Security Technology and Infrastructure for Technical ProfessionalsChatGPT and generative Al-based products, such as Microsoft 365 Copilot, have seen huge
interest in adoption. Security and risk management technical professionals should adoptthe recommendations in this research to minimize sensitive data loss while continuing to
explore generative Al.  
More on This Topic
This is part of an in-depth collection of research. See the collection:e Security Leaderâ€™s Guide to Data Security  
Quick Answer
How can | use ChatGPT and generative Al (GenAl) securely with minimal sensitive data  
loss?  
e Use security service edge (SSE) to block sensitive information from being entered intoboth the ChatGPT prompt interface and API interface.  
e Carefully examine data security measures from commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) GenAl
products â€” such as Microsoft 365 Copilot â€” to ensure it satisfies your sensitive dataprotection requirements.  
e Build your own GenAl-based application using hosted foundational models to protect
sensitive information with Azure OpenAl Service built-in security measures.e Train your own domain-specific large language model (LLM) with proprietary data to have
the most control over sensitive data protection. This represents an alternative to using  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 1/9Page 2:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss
i pretrained models directly.
More Detail  
ChatGPT and generative Al (GenAl) attract massive interest from multiple industry verticals withthe potential to disrupt many disciplines. While technology and other practitioners from different
sectors continue to explore what ChatGPT can do, security incidents of sensitive data leakagehave started to surface. For example, Samsung has banned the use of ChatGPT on company-
owned devices and internal networks after employees uploaded source code into ChatGPT tocheck for errors. Also, Apple and some large U.S. banks have used similar measures to restrict
the internal use of ChatGPT and other GenAl tools.  
For ChatGPT or GenAl to provide insights that satisfy unique business needs, these tools oftenneed access to organizational proprietary and sensitive datasets. Accordingly, organizational
data could be fed into ChatGPT and GenAl as:  
e System prompts to generate responses from the LLM that combine organizational data.e Training dataset to fine-tune a hosted foundational model, such as GPT-3 in Azure OpenAl.  
e Training dataset to train the domain-specific LLM model from scratch, such as
BloombergGPT.BloombergGPT.  
e Data fed into ChatGPT or other LLM-powered search engines as they crawl through
documents.  
This research discusses critical data security considerations in four ChatGPT and GenAladoption patterns to minimize sensitive data leakage risk. Privacy, regulatory compliance, Al
safety and output guardrails â€” that is, hallucination reduction â€” are out of the scope of thisresearch. Figure 1 illustrates how much control customers have over data security measures
across four adoption patterns.  
Figure 1: Generative Al Shared Responsibility Model Â¥  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 2/9Page 3:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Generative Al Shared Responsibility Model (Data Security)  
i Customer Responsibility | Provider Responsibility  
Build Your Own App onBuild Your Own App on
a Foundational Model  
ChatGPT COTS GenAl Train Your Own LLM  
GenAl
Application  
Large
Language
Model  
Source: Gartner
COTS = commercial off-the-shelf; GenAl = generative Al; LLM = large language model
793773_C  
Gartner.793773_C  
Gartner.  
Use Security Service Edge to Block Sensitive Information From Entering Into ChatGPT  
While OpenAl disclosed a number of data controls available in ChatGPT service, manyorganizations are not comfortable with their employees sending sensitive data to ChatGPT. The
SSE forward proxy module can mask, redact or block sensitive data in-line as itâ€™s being enteredinto ChatGPT as a prompt. Security and risk management technical professionals should use
the block option to prevent sensitive data from entering ChatGPT from web or API interfaces.Some SSE vendors are creating a new web category called â€œgenerative Al,â€ and it is
recommended to block sensitive data upload into the â€œgenerative Alâ€ category.The new Bing search chat function is built on top of GPT-4 and has an HTTP client built-in,
allowing users prompting Bing to crawl through external websites and generate insights. Ensureorganizational data loss prevention (DLP) policy is in place. Doing so helps that sensitive
content is not externally shared and accessible from corporate-managed IT resources for thenew Bing search function to crawl through. Organizations should also use SSE or cloud security
posture management (CSPM) to ensure employees do not share sensitive content externallyusing cloud content-sharing solutions, such as OneDrive, Box or Amazon S3. Ultimately, instruct
the new Bing search function to crawl through sensitive content.  
With the release of ChatGPT app for iOS, organizations should use enterprise mobilitymanagement (EMM) to limit employeesâ€™ ability to copy sensitive data from corporate-managed
apps into ChatGPT app.  
Carefully Examine Data Security Measures From COTS Gen-Al ServiceMicrosoft 365 Copilot was announced in March 2023. 1 It is the first prominent COTS GenAl
service â€” also referred to as generative micro apps â€” and has shown huge potential infundamentally changing how business content is created. Although promising, security and risk  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 3/9  
Page 4:Page 4:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss
management technical professionals must examine data security measures and understand the
security implications of Microsoft 365 Copilot.When Microsoft 365 Copilot becomes generally available, organizations should plan their
adoption strategy depending on the data type they are working with. There are three possible
scenarios.  
Scenario 1scenarios.  
Scenario 1  
Organizations dealing with public data without internal or external requirements to protect the
confidentiality of such datasets. These organizations should embrace Microsoft 365 Copilot tounleash creativity, unlock productivity and uplevel skills.  
Scenario 2  
Organizations dealing with proprietary or customer data with internal policy or external regulatory
compliance requirements to protect the confidentiality of such datasets.Microsoft provided high-level insights on the security, compliance and privacy measures used in
Microsoft 365 Copilot in the product announcement. ' It is reasonable to expect more detailedinformation about Microsoft 365 Copilotâ€™s data security measures will be made available by
Microsoft as we get closer to the general availability (GA) release.In the interim, Microsoft provided Gartner with additional details regarding Microsoft 365
Copilot data security measures that are not yet available through Microsoft documentation.Organizations that need to protect proprietary or customer-sensitive data should examine the
questions and Microsoft's responses included in Table 1.  
Table 1: Gartner Questions and Microsoft Responses About Proprietary and CustomerSensitive Data  
Gartner Questions Microsoft Responses  
Microsoft does not use user-generated Microsoft does not use UGC to train any
content (UGC) to train the foundational models used in Microsoft 365 Copilot. 7model (GPT-4) that underpins Microsoft 365  
Copilot. However, does Microsoft use UGC to  
train or fine-tune other models that might be  
part of the Microsoft 365 Copilot?  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 4/9Page 5:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM  
Does the semantic index for Microsoft 365
Copilot honor the user identity-based access
boundary so that the grounding process can
only access content the current user is
explicitly authorized to access?Does the Microsoft 365 Copilot-generated
content inherit the MPIP label from the
source UGC that the grounding process
accessed? Or does it inherit the active Office
document from which the user requested the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service?The foundational LLM (GPT-4) does not store
or track refined prompts. Itâ€™s up to the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service built on top of
the LLM to store the prompts after the
current session terminates. How does the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service protectprompts if it is stored?  
Once grounded with UGC, the refined prompt
will most likely contain customer-sensitive
data that is sent to the LLM to generate a
response. Is the refined prompt only
transient in memory, or is it persisted in thestorage layer?  
Does Microsoft personnel have access to
prompt, refined prompt and response data
for human review and debugging purposes
within the boundary of Microsoft 365 Copilot
service?  
How does Microsoft privacy-preservingmachine learning (ML) help customers
protect their sensitive data in the context of
Microsoft 365 Copilot?  
Source: Gartner (July 2023)  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfileQuick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
The Microsoft 365 Copilot uses current usersâ€™
credentials to access data. Therefore, it
cannot access anything the user does not
have access to.have access to.  
There is no label inheritance in place. The
Microsoft 365 Copilot-generated content will
cite the original source UGC, which will retain
the label.  
Usersâ€™ prompts to Microsoft 365 Copilot arestored in the Intelligent Conversation and
Communication Cloud (IC3), the back-end
services used by Microsoft Teams. Microsoft
plans to use this same back end for the
Microsoft 365 Copilot. IC3 supports
compliance features such as e-discovery.The refined prompt is transient in memory in
the Microsoft-hosted LLM runtime. This is a
different feature from OpenAl-hosted GPT
services.

approves the user, including such data whenthey provide feedback to improve the service.  
Privacy-preserving ML does not apply to
Microsoft 365 Copilot.

Page 6:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data LossBecause MPIP label inheritance is not currently supported, Gartner recommends organizations
that have already rolled out MPIP to develop a strategy to ensure that Microsoft 365 Copilot-generated documents are protected with proper labels with either manual labels (E3 customers)
or autolabels (E5 customers).  
Gartner anticipates Microsoft to provide more details to the following questions as we getcloser to the GA release of Microsoft 365 Copilot:  
e Does the grounding process have read access into MPIP-protected UGC â€” with Microsoft-
managed keys or bring your own key (BYOK) â€” that the current user is entitled to access?e Can any other back-end service different than LLM runtime access and read refined prompts
and response data?  
e Microsoft 365 Copilot stores refined prompts in IC3. Is IC3 isolated within a client's tenantboundary? Who can access refined prompts in IC3? Can a client opt to delete refined
prompts? Does it generate an access log if refined prompts are accessed or deleted? Cana
client opt to encrypt refined prompts?  
Scenario 3Scenario 3  
Organizations dealing with highly sensitive data that already use MPIP with DKE option or third-
party encryption gateway to prevent Microsoft indexing or e-discovery service from accessingtheir data while stored in Microsoft 365 cloud.  
Continue to use MPIP with DKE or third-party encryption gateway to encrypt most sensitive
content while stored in Microsoft 365 cloud. During the grounding processing, Microsoft 365Copilot has access to encrypted content through Microsoft Graph API. However, it cannot
decrypt â€” as long as you do not grant Microsoft 365 Copilot access to the self-hosted DKE
service or the encryption gatewayâ€™s decryption service.If Microsoft 365 Copilot could be accessed from desktop apps through an additional plug-in
installation, do not install the plug-in into Office desktop apps. Microsoft 365 Copilot plug-in canhave potential access to UGC from within the Microsoft Office apps regardless of whether MPIP
protects the file with DKE or any third-party encryption gateways. As more details aboutMicrosoft 365 Copilot become available, evaluate whether the Microsoft 365 Copilot plug-in can
differentiate and respect the confidentiality protection provided by the MPIP with DKE.Build Your GenAl-Based Application Using Hosted Foundational Models  
Microsoft Azure OpenAl Service is a great option for organizations interested in building GPT-based applications â€” together with other foundational models â€” using proprietary, confidential
data. This approach provides organizations with greater flexibility in securing their confidential  
data. Highlights of data security measures include: Â°https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 6/9  
Page 7:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Losse Customer is responsible for the application, including the security aspect, built on top of
Microsoft Azure OpenAl Service.  
e Confidential data could be fed into Microsoft Azure OpenAl Service as prompt or training
data.data.  
e Prompts and completion are not stored in the deployed model runtime â€” whether custom
fine-tuned model or base models â€” except for a separate copy of prompts and completionsstored for Microsoft human review or debugging purposes that could be turned off with client
request and Microsoft approval.  
e Customer-uploaded training data and fine-tuned models are stored in Azure Storage andencrypted at rest by Microsoft-managed keys, with the option to use customer-managed keys
(CMkKs). The training data and fine-tuned models are logically isolated with Azure
subscription and API credentials.Train Your Own Domain-Specific LLM Using Proprietary Data  
Organizations training domain-specific LLM using proprietary data will have the most control
over sensitive data protection â€” examples include BloombergGPT. This is the best option froma data security perspective. This approach is only viable for organizations with the right ML and
deep learning skills, compute resources and budget.

num_points = 50

Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±rmak DiÄŸer Ä°stem GÃ¼venirliÄŸini ArttÄ±ran YÃ¶ntemlerBiÃ§imlendirme ipuÃ§larÄ±: Matematiksel semboller, denklemler veya deÄŸiÅŸkenler iÃ§in LaTeX formatÄ±nÄ± veya aÃ§Ä±k gÃ¶sterimleri kullanÄ±n.Hata yÃ¶netimi: LLMâ€™in yapabileceÄŸi olasÄ± hatalarÄ± veya yanlÄ±ÅŸ anlamalarÄ± tahmin edip ve bu durumlarÄ±n nasÄ±l ele alÄ±nacaÄŸÄ± konusunda ona aÃ§Ä±kÃ§a talimat verebilrsiniz. SÄ±caklÄ±k (temperature) DeÄŸiÅŸkeniSÄ±caklÄ±k, dil modeli tarafÄ±ndan oluÅŸturulan Ã§Ä±ktÄ±nÄ±n rastgeleliÄŸini kontrol eden bir hiperparametredir. Maksimum token, model tarafÄ±ndan oluÅŸturulan Ã§Ä±ktÄ±nÄ±n uzunluÄŸunu belirler. YanÄ±ttaki tokenlerin sayÄ±sÄ±nÄ± kontrol ederek dil modelinin ayrÄ±ntÄ± dÃ¼zeyini etkileyebilmemize olanak tanÄ±r.Daha yÃ¼ksek maksimum token deÄŸeri daha uzun yanÄ±tlar, daha fazla ayrÄ±ntÄ± ve konu dÄ±ÅŸÄ±na Ã§Ä±kma ÅŸansÄ±nÄ±n daha yÃ¼ksek olmasÄ±nÄ± saÄŸlarken daha dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼k maksimum token deÄŸeri daha kÄ±sa ve daha Ã¶zlÃ¼ yanÄ±tlar verilmesini saÄŸlar ancak Ã¶nemli bilgilerinancak Ã¶nemli bilgilerin kesilmesine neden olabilir.LLM AyarlarÄ± En iyi K (top_k) DeÄŸiÅŸkeni  
En iyi K Ã¶rneklemesi, dil modelinin dikkate alabileceÄŸi tahmin edilen sÃ¶zcÃ¼k sayÄ±sÄ±nÄ± sÄ±nÄ±rlamamÄ±zÄ± saÄŸlÄ±yor.Daha kÃ¼Ã§Ã¼k bir K deÄŸeri belirleyerek Ã§Ä±ktÄ±nÄ±n baÄŸlamsal odaÄŸÄ±nÄ± kÄ±sÄ±tlayabilir ve modelin ilgisiz bilgiler Ã¼retmesini engelleyebilirsiniz.YÃ¼ksek Top-K deÄŸeri kullanÄ±rken model daha fazla kelime seÃ§eneÄŸini dikkate alÄ±r ve Ã§eÅŸitli iÃ§erikler oluÅŸturabilir, ancak konu dÄ±ÅŸÄ±na Ã§Ä±kma riski daha yÃ¼ksektir.DÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼k Top-K deÄŸeri kullanÄ±rken modelin kelime seÃ§eneklerini sÄ±nÄ±rlar, bu da odaklanmÄ±ÅŸ ve ilgili bir iÃ§erik oluÅŸmasÄ±nÄ± saÄŸlar.  
LLM AyarlarÄ± En iyi K (top_k) DeÄŸiÅŸkeni (Devam)En yÃ¼ksek olasÄ±lÄ±klÄ± k token getirilir. LLM AyarlarÄ± En iyi K (top_k) DeÄŸiÅŸkeniEn iyi K Ã¶rneklemesi, dil modelinin dikkate alabileceÄŸi tahmin edilen sÃ¶zcÃ¼k sayÄ±sÄ±nÄ± sÄ±nÄ±rlamaya yÃ¶nelik bir yaklaÅŸÄ±mdÄ±r. Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Test EdiciÄ°stem Ã–rnekleri Test Edici

Hata ayÄ±klama, kod oluÅŸturma, yeniden biÃ§imlendirme, aÃ§Ä±klama ve daha fazlasÄ± iÃ§in LLMâ€™leri kullanabilirsiniz.KÄ±demsiz bir python programcÄ±sÄ±sÄ±n. verbs = ['run', 'jump', 'dance', 'sing', 'laugh', 'cry']

noun = random.choice(nouns)

print(madlib) Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Kodu Yorumlama ve Yeniden BiÃ§imlendirmekLLMâ€™den kodunuzu aÃ§Ä±klamasÄ±nÄ± ve okunabilirliÄŸi arttÄ±rmak iÃ§in yeniden biÃ§imlendirmesini isteyebilirsiniz.
LÃ¼tfen bu Python koduna aÃ§Ä±kla ve okunabilirlik iÃ§in yeniden biÃ§imlendir:

frequency = 2
num_points = 50frequency = 2
num_points = 50
for i in range(num_points):

Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Kodu Optimize EtmeKomut dosyanÄ±zÄ±n yÃ¼rÃ¼tÃ¼lmesi Ã§ok uzun sÃ¼rÃ¼yorsa LLMâ€™ler onu optimize edebilir.

Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Programlama Dilleri ArasÄ± Ã‡eviriProgramlarÄ± bir dilden diÄŸerine taÅŸÄ±ma yeteneÄŸinin tipik bir kullanÄ±mÄ±, eski bir dildeki kodu daha modern bir dile yÃ¼kseltmek olabilir:Hem COBOL hem de Python bilgisine sahip deneyimli bir geliÅŸtirici gibi davran ve bu COBOL programÄ±nÄ± Python'a dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼r:

PROGRAM-ID. CALCULATE-SS-TAX.
DATA DIVISION.
WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
01 SALARY PIC 9(7)V99.01 SALARY PIC 9(7)V99.
01 SS-TAX PIC 9(7)V99.
PROCEDURE DIVISION.
DISPLAY "Enter employee's salary: ".
ACCEPT SALARY.
COMPUTE SS-TAX = SALARY * 0.062.
DISPLAY "Social Security tax is: $", SS-TAX.
STOP RUN. Ã‡Ä±ktÄ±:STOP RUN. Ã‡Ä±ktÄ±:
salary = float(input("Enter employee's salary: "))
ss_tax = salary * 0.062
print("Social Security tax is: $", round(ss_tax, 2))Burada dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼m performansÄ±nÄ± arttÄ±rma amaÃ§lÄ± yapÄ±labilecek bir baÅŸka yaklaÅŸÄ±m, Ã¶nce eski kodu pseudocode veya algoritmaâ€™ya dÃ¶nÃ¼ÅŸtÃ¼rÃ¼p ondan yeni bir kod oluÅŸturmaktÄ±r. Ä°stem Ã–rnekleri Programlama Ä°stemÃ–rnekleri Programlama Ä°stem Ã–rnekleriÄ°stem Yazarken SÄ±k YapÄ±lan Hatalar Modelinizin Ä°steÄŸinizi YanlÄ±ÅŸ Tahmin EtmesiBazen LLMâ€™ler isteminizin amacÄ±nÄ± tam olarak anlayamayabilir ve genel veya gÃ¼venli yanÄ±tlar Ã¼retebilir. Experiment :  
RUG (Retrieval-augmented generation) :  
Embeding :  
ML(machine learning) :  
Inference : the act of generating text  
neural network :  
Vector :  
Prompt : The text that you feed into the model  
Token :Token :

WeÄ±ght :  
Output text : completion  
Context window : The full amount of text or the memory that is available to
use for the promptuse for the prompt  
Prompt engineering : you'll frequently encounter situations where the model
doesn't produce the outcome that you want on the first try. You may have torevise the language in your prompt or the way that it's written several times
to get the model to behave in the way that you want. This work to develop and
iprove the prompt is known as prompt engineering.In-context learning : Providing examples inside the context window is called
in-context learning.  
zero-shot inference : Prompt as an instruction to produce the completionone-shot inference : Prompt as an instruction to produce the completion and
also has an example how to do it.  
few-shot inference : Sometimes a single example won't be enough for the modelto learn what you want it to do. So you can extend the idea of giving a single
example to include multiple examples. This is known as few-shot inferenceZure Ã¼zerinden OpenAI kullanÄ±mÄ± saÄŸlanmaktadÄ±r. AyrÄ±ca Google modellerine
eriÅŸim de softtech adreslerinize yetkilendirilmektedir.

image-2023-11-3_8-55-29.png\v_ How does this course differ from Al for Everyone?  
The world of Al has changed rapidly in the past 18 months. Large language models (LLMs) and other generative Alapplications have taken the world by storm, and continue to evolve. Our new course teaches the most up-to-date
information regarding these revolutionary tools and technologies.  
\Y_ Who is this course for?\Y_ Who is this course for?  
This course is designed to provide value to anyone interested in learning about generative Al, its impacts, and how to.use it. Business leaders will learn how generative Al can impact business, and how to develop a generative Al strategy
to increase productivity, professionals will gain practical experience using Al in the workplace, and Al tools andtechniques to apply at work. Developers working outside the world of Al will get a foundational knowledge of the
current state of Al that will help in upskilling or reskilling in the realm of Al.Alis a transformative technology that will impact everyone. Understanding how it works and how to use it puts you in
the driverâ€™s seat.  
\v_ Do! need prior experience?  
No, this course doesnâ€™t require any prior knowledge of Al or coding skills.Konu : Prompt Engineering - GÃ¼venlik

Transcript :  
Ã¶zet:  
The primary concern is the trustworthiness and security of LLMs, especially
when they are deployed in production[1].
The discussed company is focused on securing LLMs by reducing theirvulnerability to attacks, such as the exposure of sensitive training data, and
mitigating risks associated with deployment[2]``[3].
They introduced a set of tools and methods aimed at automatically assessingLLM risks and protecting models during development and deployment. This
involves both red teaming (testing for weaknesses) and blue teaming
(protecting against them) in a continuous improvement cycle[4]``[5].A concept of a trust score was presented, which would provide a radial map of
various dimensions of harm for LLMs. This includes evaluating LLMs based on a
large dataset of prompts that are both innocuous and designed to elicit
harmful outputs[6].harmful outputs[6].
A discussion of expanding the focus from models to agents and multi-agent
systems was mentioned, emphasizing the need to build security into the
platform layer before applications[7].Key considerations for Turkish partners include the localization of the
offering (translating prompts and responses to Turkish), regulations
preventing the use of cloud solutions for personal and banking data in Turkey,and enhancing models to work with Turkish language effectively[8].
The representatives from the developed company show an intent to work closely
with IshBank and SoftTech to tailor the solution to their specific needs andregulations, and they propose starting with a proof of concept (POC) to allow
testing and incremental evaluation of capabilities. Feedback from the
attendees indicates that they see potential in the offering but would like tosee the solutions in action to assess their effectiveness before making
further commitments. The meeting concludes with a sense of agreement on the
validity of the problems being tackled and interest in proceeding with duediligence and evaluation from IshBank's and SoftTech's data science teams.

Feature: demo_StudioOnPlateau
Scenario: Step1_Login StudioOnPlateau
Given validate initial Login pageAnd write Email "byburakyesiltas+51@gmail.com"
And write Password "Aa123456"
When clicks on Login button
Then user is navigate to the home page
Example Output
public class Login extends DriverManager {
@Given("validate initial Login page")public void validate_initial_Login_page() {
WebElement loginPage = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//h1[text()='Login']", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Assertion.ElementExist(loginPage);
}
@And("write Email {string}")
public void write_Email(String email) {WebElement emailTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_email", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(emailTbx, email, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@And("write Password {string}")
public void write_Password(String password) {WebElement passwordTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_loginPassword", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(passwordTbx, password, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@When("clicks on Login button")
public void clicks_on_Login_button() {WebElement loginBtn = Find.Element(Locator.id, "studioauth_login-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.clickFunction(loginBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}
@Then("user is navigate to the home page")
public void user_is_navigate_to_the_home_page() {WebElement homePage = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//img[@id='dropdownMenuButton1']", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Assertion.ElementExist(homePage);
}
} Senaryolardan test otomasyonu yazÄ±mÄ± Input
Scenario: Step2_Create OrganizationGiven clicks on Create Organization button
And write Organization Name "TestOtomasyonYZ"
When clicks on Organization Create button
Then verify Organization Name "TestOtomasyonYZ" Senaryolardan test otomasyonu yazÄ±mÄ± Google Outputpublic class CreateOrganization extends DriverManager {  
@Given("clicks on Create Organization button")
public void clicks_on_Create_Organization_button() {WebElement createOrgBtn = Find.Element(Locator.id, "create-organization-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.clickFunction(createOrgBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@And("write Organization Name {string}")public void write_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement orgNameTbx = Find.Element(Locator.id, "organization-name", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.sendKeysFunction(orgNameTbx, organizationName, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}}  
@When("clicks on Organization Create button")
public void clicks_on_Organization_Create_button() {
WebElement createOrgBtn = Find.Element(Locator.id, "create-organization-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);Util.clickFunction(createOrgBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@Then("verify Organization Name {string}")
public void verify_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement orgName = Find.Element(Locator.id, "organization-name", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);Assertion.TextExactMatch(orgName, organizationName);
}  
} Senaryolardan test otomasyonu yazÄ±mÄ± Our Code
public class CreateOrganization extends DriverManager {  
@Given("clicks on Create Organization button")public void clicks_on_Create_Organization_button() {
WebElement createOrganizationBtn = Find.Element(Locator.className, "create-organization-button", FTimeOut.HIGH);
Util.clickFunction(createOrganizationBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}}  
@And("write Organization Name {string}")
public void write_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement organizationNameTbx = Find.Element(Locator.className, "inputClass", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);Util.sendKeysFunction(organizationNameTbx, organizationName, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@When("clicks on Organization Create button")
public void clicks_on_Organization_Create_button() {WebElement organizationCreateBtn = Find.Element(Locator.className, "create-button", FTimeOut.MIDDLE);
Util.clickFunction(organizationCreateBtn, TimeOut.MIDDLE);
}  
@Then("verify Organization Name {string}")public void verify_Organization_Name(String organizationName) {
WebElement organizationNameTxt = Find.Element(Locator.xPath, "//div[@class='selected selected-org']//div[text()='" + organizationName + " ']", FTimeOut.HIGH);Assertion.ElementExist(organizationNameTxt);
}

Ã–rnekler yapay zeka iÃ§in bir model gÃ¶revi gÃ¶rebilir ve baÅŸarÄ±lÄ± bir yanÄ±tÄ±n nasÄ±l olmasÄ± gerektiÄŸine dair bir fikirgerektiÄŸine dair bir fikir verebilir. Ä°yi Ä°stemler YazmanÄ±n PÃ¼f NoktalarÄ± YapÄ±landÄ±rÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ Bir Ã‡Ä±ktÄ± Ä°stemek"<inceleme>" etiketinin iÃ§ine alÄ±nmÄ±ÅŸ metinden `product` (Ã¼rÃ¼nÃ¼n adÄ±), `isPositive` (boolean), `summary` anahtarlarÄ±nÄ± iÃ§eren bir JSON nesnesi oluÅŸturmama yardÄ±mcÄ± ol.

### Transformers  
* Encoder Only Models :  
also work as sequence-to-sequence models, but without further modification,the input sequence and the output sequence or the same length. Their use is
less common these days, but by adding additional layers to the architecture,
you can train encoder-only models to perform classification tasks such assentiment analysis, BERT is an example of an encoder-only model.  
aynÄ± zamanda diziden diziye modeller olarak da Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r, ancak daha fazla
deÄŸiÅŸiklik yapÄ±lmadan giriÅŸ dizisi ve Ã§Ä±kÄ±ÅŸ dizisi veya aynÄ± uzunlukta olur.GÃ¼nÃ¼mÃ¼zde bunlarÄ±n kullanÄ±mÄ± daha az yaygÄ±ndÄ±r, ancak mimariye ek katmanlar
ekleyerek duyarlÄ±lÄ±k analizi gibi sÄ±nÄ±flandÄ±rma gÃ¶revlerini gerÃ§ekleÅŸtirmek
iÃ§in yalnÄ±zca kodlayÄ±cÄ± modellerini eÄŸitebilirsiniz; BERT yalnÄ±zca kodlayÄ±cÄ±modeline bir Ã¶rnektir.  
* Encoder-Decoder Models :  
as you've seen, perform well on sequence-to-sequence tasks such as
translation, where the input sequence and the output sequence can be differentlengths. You can also scale and train this type of model to perform general
text generation tasks. Examples of encoder-decoder models include BART as
opposed to BERT and T5, the model that you'll use in the labs in this course.gÃ¶rdÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼nÃ¼z gibi, giriÅŸ sÄ±rasÄ± ve Ã§Ä±kÄ±ÅŸ sÄ±rasÄ±nÄ±n farklÄ± uzunluklarda
olabildiÄŸi Ã§eviri gibi sÄ±ralÄ± sÄ±ralÄ± gÃ¶revlerde iyi performans gÃ¶sterin.
AyrÄ±ca genel metin oluÅŸturma gÃ¶revlerini gerÃ§ekleÅŸtirmek iÃ§in bu model tÃ¼rÃ¼nÃ¼Ã¶lÃ§eklendirebilir ve eÄŸitebilirsiniz. KodlayÄ±cÄ±-kod Ã§Ã¶zÃ¼cÃ¼ modellerine Ã¶rnek
olarak, bu kursta laboratuvarlarda kullanacaÄŸÄ±nÄ±z model olan BERT ve T5'in
aksine BART gÃ¶sterilebilir.  
* Decoder Only Models :* Decoder Only Models :  
are some of the most commonly used today. Again, as they have scaled, their
capabilities have grown. These models can now generalize to most tasks.Popular encoder-only models include the GPT family of models, BLOOM, Jurassic,
LLaMA, and many more.

Quick Answer_ How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss.pdfPage 1:9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Gartner.  
Licensed for Distribution  
This research note is restricted to the personal use of Lutfi Ulusoy
(lutfu.ulusoy@softtech.com.tr).Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative Al
Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Published 11 July 2023 - ID G00793773 - 10 min read  
By Dennis Xu, Avivah Litan  
Initiatives: Security Technology and Infrastructure for Technical ProfessionalsChatGPT and generative Al-based products, such as Microsoft 365 Copilot, have seen huge
interest in adoption. Security and risk management technical professionals should adoptthe recommendations in this research to minimize sensitive data loss while continuing to
explore generative Al.  
More on This Topic
This is part of an in-depth collection of research. See the collection:e Security Leaderâ€™s Guide to Data Security  
Quick Answer
How can | use ChatGPT and generative Al (GenAl) securely with minimal sensitive data  
loss?  
e Use security service edge (SSE) to block sensitive information from being entered intoboth the ChatGPT prompt interface and API interface.  
e Carefully examine data security measures from commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) GenAl
products â€” such as Microsoft 365 Copilot â€” to ensure it satisfies your sensitive dataprotection requirements.  
e Build your own GenAl-based application using hosted foundational models to protect
sensitive information with Azure OpenAl Service built-in security measures.e Train your own domain-specific large language model (LLM) with proprietary data to have
the most control over sensitive data protection. This represents an alternative to using  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 1/9Page 2:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss
i pretrained models directly.
More Detail  
ChatGPT and generative Al (GenAl) attract massive interest from multiple industry verticals withthe potential to disrupt many disciplines. While technology and other practitioners from different
sectors continue to explore what ChatGPT can do, security incidents of sensitive data leakagehave started to surface. For example, Samsung has banned the use of ChatGPT on company-
owned devices and internal networks after employees uploaded source code into ChatGPT tocheck for errors. Also, Apple and some large U.S. banks have used similar measures to restrict
the internal use of ChatGPT and other GenAl tools.  
For ChatGPT or GenAl to provide insights that satisfy unique business needs, these tools oftenneed access to organizational proprietary and sensitive datasets. Accordingly, organizational
data could be fed into ChatGPT and GenAl as:  
e System prompts to generate responses from the LLM that combine organizational data.e Training dataset to fine-tune a hosted foundational model, such as GPT-3 in Azure OpenAl.  
e Training dataset to train the domain-specific LLM model from scratch, such as
BloombergGPT.BloombergGPT.  
e Data fed into ChatGPT or other LLM-powered search engines as they crawl through
documents.  
This research discusses critical data security considerations in four ChatGPT and GenAladoption patterns to minimize sensitive data leakage risk. Privacy, regulatory compliance, Al
safety and output guardrails â€” that is, hallucination reduction â€” are out of the scope of thisresearch. Figure 1 illustrates how much control customers have over data security measures
across four adoption patterns.  
Figure 1: Generative Al Shared Responsibility Model Â¥  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 2/9Page 3:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
Generative Al Shared Responsibility Model (Data Security)  
i Customer Responsibility | Provider Responsibility  
Build Your Own App onBuild Your Own App on
a Foundational Model  
ChatGPT COTS GenAl Train Your Own LLM  
GenAl
Application

COTS = commercial off-the-shelf; GenAl = generative Al; LLM = large language model
793773_C  
Gartner.793773_C  
Gartner.  
Use Security Service Edge to Block Sensitive Information From Entering Into ChatGPT  
While OpenAl disclosed a number of data controls available in ChatGPT service, manyorganizations are not comfortable with their employees sending sensitive data to ChatGPT. The
SSE forward proxy module can mask, redact or block sensitive data in-line as itâ€™s being enteredinto ChatGPT as a prompt. Security and risk management technical professionals should use
the block option to prevent sensitive data from entering ChatGPT from web or API interfaces.Some SSE vendors are creating a new web category called â€œgenerative Al,â€ and it is
recommended to block sensitive data upload into the â€œgenerative Alâ€ category.The new Bing search chat function is built on top of GPT-4 and has an HTTP client built-in,
allowing users prompting Bing to crawl through external websites and generate insights. Ensureorganizational data loss prevention (DLP) policy is in place. Doing so helps that sensitive
content is not externally shared and accessible from corporate-managed IT resources for thenew Bing search function to crawl through. Organizations should also use SSE or cloud security
posture management (CSPM) to ensure employees do not share sensitive content externallyusing cloud content-sharing solutions, such as OneDrive, Box or Amazon S3. Ultimately, instruct
the new Bing search function to crawl through sensitive content.  
With the release of ChatGPT app for iOS, organizations should use enterprise mobilitymanagement (EMM) to limit employeesâ€™ ability to copy sensitive data from corporate-managed
apps into ChatGPT app.  
Carefully Examine Data Security Measures From COTS Gen-Al ServiceMicrosoft 365 Copilot was announced in March 2023. 1 It is the first prominent COTS GenAl
service â€” also referred to as generative micro apps â€” and has shown huge potential infundamentally changing how business content is created. Although promising, security and risk  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfile 3/9  
Page 4:Page 4:
9/22/23, 6:18 PM Quick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss
management technical professionals must examine data security measures and understand the
security implications of Microsoft 365 Copilot.When Microsoft 365 Copilot becomes generally available, organizations should plan their
adoption strategy depending on the data type they are working with. There are three possible
scenarios.  
Scenario 1scenarios.  
Scenario 1  
Organizations dealing with public data without internal or external requirements to protect the
confidentiality of such datasets. These organizations should embrace Microsoft 365 Copilot tounleash creativity, unlock productivity and uplevel skills.  
Scenario 2  
Organizations dealing with proprietary or customer data with internal policy or external regulatory
compliance requirements to protect the confidentiality of such datasets.Microsoft provided high-level insights on the security, compliance and privacy measures used in
Microsoft 365 Copilot in the product announcement. ' It is reasonable to expect more detailedinformation about Microsoft 365 Copilotâ€™s data security measures will be made available by
Microsoft as we get closer to the general availability (GA) release.In the interim, Microsoft provided Gartner with additional details regarding Microsoft 365
Copilot data security measures that are not yet available through Microsoft documentation.Organizations that need to protect proprietary or customer-sensitive data should examine the
questions and Microsoft's responses included in Table 1.  
Table 1: Gartner Questions and Microsoft Responses About Proprietary and CustomerSensitive Data  
Gartner Questions Microsoft Responses  
Microsoft does not use user-generated Microsoft does not use UGC to train any
content (UGC) to train the foundational models used in Microsoft 365 Copilot. 7model (GPT-4) that underpins Microsoft 365  
Copilot. However, does Microsoft use UGC to  
train or fine-tune other models that might be  
part of the Microsoft 365 Copilot?

content inherit the MPIP label from the
source UGC that the grounding process
accessed? Or does it inherit the active Office
document from which the user requested the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service?The foundational LLM (GPT-4) does not store
or track refined prompts. Itâ€™s up to the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service built on top of
the LLM to store the prompts after the
current session terminates. How does the
Microsoft 365 Copilot service protectprompts if it is stored?

will most likely contain customer-sensitive
data that is sent to the LLM to generate a
response. Is the refined prompt only
transient in memory, or is it persisted in thestorage layer?

prompt, refined prompt and response data
for human review and debugging purposes
within the boundary of Microsoft 365 Copilot

Source: Gartner (July 2023)  
https://www.gartner.com/document/4517999 ?ref=AnalystProfileQuick Answer: How to Use ChatGPT and Generative AI Securely With Minimal Data Loss  
The Microsoft 365 Copilot uses current usersâ€™
credentials to access data. Therefore, it
cannot access anything the user does not
have access to.have access to.  
There is no label inheritance in place. The
Microsoft 365 Copilot-generated content will
cite the original source UGC, which will retain
the label.  
Usersâ€™ prompts to Microsoft 365 Copilot arestored in the Intelligent Conversation and
Communication Cloud (IC3), the back-end
services used by Microsoft Teams. Microsoft
plans to use this same back end for the
Microsoft 365 Copilot. IC3 supports
compliance features such as e-discovery.The refined prompt is transient in memory in
the Microsoft-hosted LLM runtime. This is a
different feature from OpenAl-hosted GPT
services.

approves the user, including such data whenthey provide feedback to improve the service.
